# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a simple implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        # Check if adding the next word would exceed the text_width
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + (current_line != "" ? 1 : 0) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= (current_line != "" ? " " : "") * word
        end
    end

    wrapped_text *= current_line  # Append the last line
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage
text = "This is an example of a string that needs to be wrapped."
wrapped_result = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_result)
```
